page.title: 14 HOUSING
page.content: There are many different sorts of dwellings including farm houses,villas cottages,semi detached,detached and bunglows in this area.Cotton Hall Farm has many rooms and out houses. By Faber School,built in 1847,there are semi detatched and terraced houses, wich were built between 1809 and 1973. The oldest houses are St. Teresa's Cottages.The Old Star Public House,now called Star Green Farm,used to be The Blazing Star when it was a Public House because a local furnace used to smelt Iron and Copper in about 1780. Some old furnace bricks were seen by Mr Cope at Star Green when his present home was built.Another large building is Whiston Hall built about 1875 and now the home of Tom Copper who runs an 18 hole Golf Course and provides bar facilities for visitors,who pay 100 pounds per year for membership.
